title: If superpowers were real: Super strength - Joy Lin

multiple-choice.question: If you wake up with 1,000 times your normal strength, how will you handle delicate day-to-day tasks?

options.label: B
options.text: You'll have to be very careful not to break or crush objects with your increased strength.

options.label: C
options.text: You'll need to use specialized equipment to handle them safely.

options.label: D
options.text: You won't need to worry about them at all.

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: You're not strong enough to catch her, but you'll still cause her harm.

options.label: C
options.text: The fall is not the main cause of her injury.

options.label: D

options.label: A

options.label: D
options.text: You're not strong enough to hold the door.

options.label: B
options.text: You need to be able to fly up to her height quickly.

options.label: C
options.text: You need to fly up to her height, start flying down at the same speed, and gradually slow down until you come to a complete stop.

options.label: D
options.text: You need to be able to fly in any direction.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main challenge of flying to save the damsel in distress?

options.label: A
options.text: Finding a safe place to land.

options.label: C

options.text: Magically turning the pavement into marshmallow to give her enough time to slowly come to a stop.

options.label: A
options.text: The door won't be able to distribute the pressure evenly, resulting in damage to her spine.

options.text: The pressure exerted on her body will cause her spine to be damaged.

options.label: B
options.text: The mass increases proportionally to the size increase.

options.label: C

multiple-choice.question: What is the key difference in cell division between a healthy liver cell and a cancer cell?

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: A healthy liver cell divides at a moderate rate, while a hair cell divides frequently, while a cancer cell divides rapidly and recklessly.

options.label: D
